citation.article-title: Chelatococcus daeguensis sp. nov., isolated from wastewater of a textile dye works, and emended description of the genus Chelatococcus.
citation.source: International Journal of Systematic and Evolutionary Microbiology

p.s: Emended description of the genus Chelatococcus Auling et al. 1993
The description of the genus Chelatococcus is as given by Auling et al. (1993) with the following amendments.
Utilization of NTA is positive or negative.
The major fatty acids are C18 : 1ω7c and C19 : 0 cyclo ω8c.
Major polar lipids are phosphatidylcholine, phosphatidylglycerol, phosphatidylethanolamine, two aminolipids and two unidentified phospholipids.
sym-Homospermidine, spermidine and putrescine are major polyamines.
The DNA G+C content is 63.3–68.3 mol%.
